body.p: The model proposed in the 2013 Impairment Exposure Draft continued to build on a tiered approach by requiring an entity to measure:

li.p: the expected credit losses for a financial instrument at an amount equal to the lifetime expected credit losses, if the credit quality on that financial instrument has decreased significantly (or the credit risk increases significantly) since initial recognition; and
the expected credit losses for a financial instrument at an amount equal to the 12-month expected credit losses for all other financial instruments.
